page.title: 15BRIDGE & SWINDALE COTTAGES
page.content: {WYLAM BRIDGE REPAIRED The former railway bridge which crosses the river and links Hagg Bank to the village was repaired in 1985 the timber decking between the steel plates on the which the track was laid had deteriated. The supports were also strengthened.(see photo. b) {SWINDALE COTTAGES The cottages are situated near The Dene in a crescent with an attractive surrounding. Severe winter weather delayed the completion of the cottages but the old-folk were able to move in to the cottages at the end of March 1981 On Friday the 7th May 1981 the cottages were officialy named after the late Dr. Swindale who worked well and was liked very much in Wylam. The cottages were opened by members of the late doctor's family, Edward and Mary.
